definition:
1. An attendant attached to a prince or other powerful person; hence, an obsequious dependent. "The satellites of power." I. Disraeli. 2. (Astron.)  A secondary planet which revolves about another planet; as, the moon is a satellite of the earth. See Solar system, under Solar. Satellite moth (Zo√∂l.), a handsome European noctuid moth (Scopelosoma satellitia).

Situated near; accompanying; as, the satellite veins, those which accompany the arteries.
